de.uni_stuttgart.ipvs_as
Interface MapReduceWSI

public interface MapReduceWSI

MapReduceWSI is a web service end point that exposes subsets of the MR functionality of a Hadoop 2.x (YARN) clusters to clients. Clients can

  • Import structured data from RDBMS into HDFS
  • Export structured data from HDFS to RDBM
  • Deploy custom MapReduce code onto the cluster (as JAR) and run it (If additional resources are required for the MR, they should be embedded into the JAR.)
The service provides partial isolation of clients against each other. Each client obtains an application scope ID by calling createScope(). This ID is then used with other APIs to identify the scope within to run the operation. This WSI is technically stateless as to avoid that clients are forced to implement HTTP cookies or otherwise fancy technology (such as WS-Addressing). Naturally, there is state associated with the scope ID though. While different scopes enjoy file system isolation, the computational resources in the cluster are limited and simultaneously running jobs do affect each other's runtime.

Author:
- acg

Method Summary
 long createScope()
          Creates an execution scope that is isolated from other scopes.
 void deleteScope(long scopeId)
          Delete a scope previously created using createScope() This permanently deletes all file system and other cluster resources utilized by that scope.
 void importIntoHDFS(long scopeId, java.lang.String jdbcURI, java.lang.String dbName, java.lang.String dbUser, java.lang.String dbCredentials, java.lang.String query, java.lang.String destinationName)
          Import tuples from a RDBMS into HDFS

          Run a MR job from a given JAR archive.
 

Method Detail

createScope

long createScope()
Creates an execution scope that is isolated from other scopes. Clients must call this method first and use the scope ID they obtain for any further API calls. Furthermore, calls to createScope() should be matched with calls to deleteScope(long)

deleteScope

void deleteScope(long scopeId)
Delete a scope previously created using createScope() This permanently deletes all file system and other cluster resources utilized by that scope. The scope ID may not be used with any further API calls (unless re-issued by createScope()).

runMapReduce

void runMapReduce(long scopeId,
                  java.lang.String srcJarName,
                  java.lang.String[] arguments)
Run a MR job from a given JAR archive. This deploys the given JAR onto the cluster and executes the main() routine contained therein. From within the main, the client can use the YARN API to run a MR job. The first argument passed to main is the absolute prefix of all HDFS imports made via importIntoHDFS(long, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

Parameters:
arguments - Arguments to forward to the JARs main() (after the HDFS prefix)
srcJarName - Path to the (JDK 1.7-compatible) JAR on the source machine.

importIntoHDFS

void importIntoHDFS(long scopeId,
                    java.lang.String jdbcURI,
                    java.lang.String dbName,
                    java.lang.String dbUser,
                    java.lang.String dbCredentials,
                    java.lang.String query,
                    java.lang.String destinationName)
Import tuples from a RDBMS into HDFS

Parameters:
jdbcURI - JDBC URI under which the source database is accessible
query - Arbitrary SQL SELECT query to filter the input database
destinationName - Destination name under which to store the data in HDFS. Note that the actual physical HDFS path has a prefix that depends on the scope.
See Also:
#runMapReduce}
